data.title: Error calling method from signal 'changed'
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
compiled 21f965f249799d5f6adb607a6ea5a4cd728f28b0

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Error message comes up when using Material on CanvasItem nodes.

```
Error calling method from signal 'changed': 'CanvasItemMaterial::_shader_changed': Method not found.
```

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Add a Control or Node2D node to scene
2. Make a new CanvasItemMaterial of node at Material
3. Edit CanvasItemMaterial
4. Make a new CanvasItemShader or CanvasItemShaderGraph
5. Edit Shader
6. Try to do something with Shader

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Error using set_edited_scene_root from EditorPlugin
data.body:
**Issue description**:
I'm writing an editor plugin and I was trying to create a new root node from the script. So I created a simple node and tried this:
`get_tree().set_edited_scene_root(node)
`
A few days ago, this caused the editor to crash. With a more recent build (compiled from master), it doesn't crash anymore. The node doesn't seem to appear at first, but as soon as the screen gets updated (e.g. by clicking on the "add node" button and going back), the root node does appear, but the editor ignores it and behaves as if there was no root node.  The Console shows this error:

> ERROR: get_path: Condition ' !is_inside_tree() ' is true. returned: NodePath()

Is this actually a bug, or am I using this function completely wrong? There seems to be no documentation about it.

Here's a minimal example project. A plugin that adds a single button to the  bottom panel which creates a new node and calls this function:
[https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/1891681/Test_set_edited_scene_root.zip](url)

data.title: To add -DOPENSSL_ENABLED to drivers/register_driver_types.cpp compilation when openssl is enabled
data.body: So that openssl could be registered and work fine.

data.title: fix String error
data.body:
#4733 uses `vformat` with `%i`.

this causes error when open project with editor.

```
ERROR: vformat: Condition ' error ' is true. returned: String()
   At: core\variant.cpp:3090
```

because vformat doesn't have %i format.

data.title: add travis check for trailing whitespace
data.body:
This adds travis-ci check for trailing whitespace.

Proof: https://travis-ci.org/Marqin/godot/jobs/131918588

data.title: remove trailing whitespace
data.body:
fix EOLs and remove trailing whitespace, the same way as in #3928

used command:

``` bash
find . -type f \( -name "*\.cpp" -o -name "*\.h" \) -a \( ! -path "./drivers/*" \) -print0 | xargs -0 -I {} sed -i '' -e's/[[:space:]]*$//' "{}"
```

proof: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/33403d91f77f1f34b19bff763391500bc9c2616c?w=1
(add `?w=1` to commit link)

data.title: Editor is using project settings (input map actions, splash screen, etc.)
data.body:
_Bugsquad edit:_ Apparently the editor parses `engine.cfg` and reuses most of it unless there are some checks to avoid it. It should be fixed all at once, hence we'll merge related issues with this one.

---

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
The editor is using input map actions from the project's settings. Therefore, modifying input presets (`ui_*`) affects the editor too. This can break usability in many situations, like removing <kbd>ENTER</kbd> from the `ui_accept` (pressing <kbd>ENTER</kbd> when focusing a button will not longer press the button).

**Steps to reproduce:**
Actually, being able to remove keys from input presets may be a bug. [This comment](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/4315#issuecomment-209876046) explains how to do it:

> It looks like if you add another key to that action, then you can remove the other keys and it will be saved.
> Â· neikeq

The solution may be to forbid modifying input presets, but it stills seems weird that the editor is using the project's input map.

data.title: get_item_rect() needs improvements!!
data.body:
**[PROLOGUE] - ranting, sorry!**
Due to the unpredictable behavior of KinematicBody2D #1472 which I am trying to create pixel-perfect game. I am forced to use Area2D instead. I managed to make Area2D as a "solid" object with "slide" effect, following this article about [swept AABB](http://www.gamedev.net/page/resources/_/technical/game-programming/swept-aabb-collision-detection-and-response-r3084). Which regrettably, makes me forfeit the use of collision detection of Godot and implement my own, including **"snap to grid smooth movement"** which Godot Engine **doesn't have**, but most other engines (Unity, GameMaker..etc) have it supported, but that is for another issue. (it is solvable using script, but it is better to have it supported in the engine for grid games).

All of that worked fine since I worked with 64x64 pixels images in my testing project. But when I tried to work with other sizes, issues began.

**[ISSUE]**
When I call `get_item_rect()` function, I expected to get a `Rect2` that has the position of the item and the **`size` of all of its children enclosed and expanded in the Rect2 structure (fit all children)**. But I only get the size of 64x64. Also, using `get_item_rect()` for a rectangular with extents of 64x64 `CollisionShape2D` (for a 128x128 sprite) I get a 134x134 for its size **:/**

Maybe the following picture can get my idea better (excuse my 30 seconds scribble using mspaint)
![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1888186/15448294/0f1b853a-1f23-11e6-8e26-cb18c513e5a1.png)

**[EPILOGUE]**
I think Godot can easily implement this, since it already has "expand() or grow()" in Rect2 class. Besides, it will make it easier to be noticed in the editor to see the expanded rectangle with all its children.

data.title: Changes to open dir in native explorer RMB option
data.body:
Rename 'Show In System' to 'Show In File Manager'
Replace path from DirAccess::get_full_path to Globals::globalize_path

data.title: Binary to TSCN/TRES converter
data.body:
I've converted a few projects from XML or binary formats to the new TSCN/TRES formats of Godot 2.0. It's a very tiresome process, as you need to save every resource in the new format, and then fix all the broken dependencies manually.

It would be awesome to have an editor tool to convert binary SCN/RES ~~and XML~~ to TSCN/TRES (and maybe the other way around, though it wouldn't be a priority for me - but maybe not too hard as the exporter converts to SCN already on the fly).

data.title: Text Wrapping w/ Long Strings Stays Hidden
data.body:
**Godot_v2.0.3_stable_win64.exe**

I finally figured out why my text wasn't wrapping. I originally thought it was because I had it inside a vBoxContainer :8ball:  But I was wrong, if you setup a `RichTextLabel` and put in the following code:

```
[b][u]Rich Text Test[/u][/b]wwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwhey25

RichTextLabel is a flexible way of adding text to your game, with support for [i]italics[/i], [b]bold[/b] and [i][b]both[/b][/i]. [u]Underline[/u] works too.
It is also possible to include [img]res://unicorn_icon.png[/img] custom images, as well as [color=aqua][url=http://www.google.com]Custom URLs[/url][/color].

Left alignment is default,[center]but center alignment is supported,[/center][right]as well as right alignment.[/right]
[fill]Fill alignment is also supported, and allows writing very long text that will end up fitting the horizontal space entirely with  words of joy.[/fill]

For full reference [color=aqua][url=https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/richtext_bbcode]check the wiki.[/url][/color]
```

The text doesn't wrap correctly after the long `w's`, for example:

https://i.gyazo.com/4cdadddafced837d41071ea76b43ca25.gif

See how the text below the long strings wraps _correctly_, but the long string (`wwwwwwww`) continues to be hidden? Might be because line breaks dynamically determine the width? I'm not too sure

Edit: This happens when previewed too, not just the editor

data.title: "(Unsaved changes will be lost)" is too frightening
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Any version of Godot since at least 1.0betaxx on any platform

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When you quit the editor to project list, there is this nightmarish dialog box asking you to confirm :

```
Please Confirm...x
Open Project Manager ?
(Unsaved changes will be lost)
[QUIT (and do nightmares)] [Cancel (if you're too afraid to quit)]
```

It would be cool if instead of terrorizing us, the editor was kind enough to tell us what file are not save when files are not saved.

On the other hand, when you just Quit, there is no such warning.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Quit to the project list.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Documentation:Custom Drawing 2d: Dynamic custom drawing error
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 16.04 ~ godot 2.0.2

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
`func wrap(value, minVal, maxVal):`

> > `return (((value - minVal) % (maxVal - minVal)) + minVal)`

does not want to take the float that delta represents in:
`func _process(delta):`

> > `angleFrom += rotAngle * delta`
> > `angleTo += rotAngle * delta`
> > `angleFrom = wrap(angleFrom, 0, 360)`
> > `angleTo = wrap(angleTo, 0, 360)`
> > `update()` 

gives error: Invalid operands 'float' and 'int' in operator '%'.
what syntax does
`func wrap(value, minVal, maxVal):`

> > `return (((value - minVal) % (maxVal - minVal)) + minVal)`

need to be in order to accept delta value?

**Steps to reproduce:**
Running code as described in docs

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Supporting Android API 23 (Android 6.0)
data.body:
If we update build gradle to use `compileSdkVersion 23`,
`org.apache.http` package causes error. (issue #4711)

We need to use `useLibrary 'org.apache.http.legacy'` to solve this problem.
To use `useLibrary`, we need to use latest gradle also.

And now, we faced another problem with `APK Expansion` java sources.

```
/platform/android/java/src/com/google/android/vending/expansion/downloader/impl/DownloadNotification.java
137 :             mCurrentNotification.setLatestEventInfo(mContext, mCurrentTitle, mCurrentText, mContentIntent); // causes error
```

So, some of APK Expansion java sources are updated by referencing commits from https://github.com/danikula/Google-Play-Expansion-File
And dropped V3CustomNotification.java which was for android 3.0, since godot supports android 14 (4.0) above officially.

Unfortunately, another problem, The 'MissingTranslation' error was occurred.
So, build.gradle is updated to use `disable 'MissingTranslation'`

Additionally, I updated `buildToolsVersion`, `targetSdkVersion` to latest version.

I tested APK Expansion funtionality on Android 6.0 (Nexus 9, Nexus 6p) and Android 4.4 (Galaxy Note 2)  with Google Developer console.

data.title: Document the FileDialog and partial OS methods
[TRACKER] DirAccess bugs
data.body:
This issue is meant to list all bugs to `DirAccess`/the `Directory` GDScript API, so that they can be investigated all at once:
- [x] #1680 Inconsistent support for user:// vs res:// directory operations
- [x] #1872 DirAccess fails on make_dir and dir_exists with user://
- [x] #1938 No ../ when entering the folder without permissions to read
- [x] #4617 Directory::get_space_left() does not return consistent "failure" values
- [x] #4705 Directory.dir_exists() always fails on res:// type paths even though Directory.open() works

See also discussion about paths in #4700.

_Existing PRs:_
- #584 Globals::localize_path was calling change_dir to check if path exists

data.title: Development of the editor on the basis of scripts
data.body:
Currently editor of the engine is implemented in C ++. It has its advantages and disadvantages. On the benefits I will not say I want to hear them from you. Let's talk about the shortcomings.
1 The increase in compile time. Not the biggest disadvantage. Yet if you do based on the script editor you can reduce this time.
2 The complexity of development. C ++ harder than Godot script.
3 Weak customization. What would make changes in the editor will have to rebuild the engine. If he was on the script editor can be directly changed by itself in the process of project development.
Of course all this is not an indicator that would drop everything and remake editor c ++ on Godot script. Still, it may be worthwhile to move in this direction. Especially since there are examples. For example, "Kakos creator" and "urno" exactly what do. perhaps someone else.
It turned out as it is messy. I'm sorry if that :) Who thinks about this?

data.title: Added toggle for loop interpolation based on adolson's code
data.body:
This adds a "loop interpolation" toggle button next to the "loop" button in the Animation Editor.
It defaults to being on, so there shouldn't be any incompatibilities with existing projects.
This should fix #959 in a way that's agreeable to everyone.

data.title: get all local variables as dictionary using a function like in python
data.body:
i'm now reading the tutorial about saving games and i'm curious why variables aren't stored in dictionaries like python does.

it would be much easier to get all local variables with 'locals()' and may be even assign loaded from json dictionary to the locals dictionary.

it will give the ability to fully serialize a class (node) with single line of code

data.title: Font height doesn't affect on drawing
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Windows 8.1 x64 - 2.0.3

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Add some font in the TextEdit properties in the IDE
- And then connect this script to it:

```
extends TextEdit

func _ready():
    get_font("YourFontName", "").set_height(6)
```

It results in scaling down the cursor in the TextEdit while text remains default size.

---

Also please take a look at font file: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/0fa588a8301b50cff5975f6c9fe8dd7969f59f16/scene/resources/font.cpp#L525
As I see we draw one char but `height` property doesn't affect it.

Maybe I'm wrong with the understanding of the code but font height changing doesn't work.

data.title: Editor crashes when you want to create a Mesh Outline for an empty mesh.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7 64 Bit - Godot 2.0.3

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When you click on [Create Outline Mesh...] at the Menu when you have selected a MeshInstance and the Mesh in the MeshInstance Node is empty the Editor crashes with an error in the console.
I expected it to display an error dialog instead of crashing.

EDIT:
Error Message: 

```
ERROR: Vector<class Variant>::operator []: Condition ' p_index<0 || p_index>=size() ' is true. returned: aux
   At: c:\projects\godot-builds\godot\core\vector.h:132
```

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Create a MeshInstance Node
- Add a new Mesh Resource to the MeshInstance which needs to be empty
- Click on Mesh->Create Outline Mesh... at the top bar
- Click Create
- Editor will crash

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: LineShape2D uses a narrower AABB to not fill up the cache with garbage.
data.body:
Fixes #4611 

Line2D, when changing, informs its parent that it has an AABB of 20000x20000 units. With the default cache size (128), that means Â±30000 insertions in the cache!

Collision detection still doesn't work as it should, because the collision cache can't be infinite.
